flags.explanation: Interaction: Lisinopril + Spironolactone — Both ACE inhibitors and potassium-sparing diuretics increase serum potassium, risking hyperkalemia (cardiac arrhythmia).

Patient is taking Lisinopril (an ACE inhibitor) and Spironolactone (a potassium-sparing diuretic). Both medications can increase potassium levels, potentially leading to hyperkalemia. The patient's potassium level is already elevated at 6.2 mmol/L.
